newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway debt firms with stronger crown.
newsitem.headline: Norway debt firms with stronger crown.

text.p: 1400 GMT -- Norwegian bonds outperformed German Bunds as the crown firmed and Norwegian retail sales figures came out low, players said.
The market saw high activity after several days of thin trade.

"The combination of a considerably stronger crown and mild retail sales figures had a positive influence," one analyst said. "Normally retail sales carry little weight, but today it seems the figures had an unusually big effect."
Retail sales excluding vehicles and petrol were 0.7 percent lower in March year on year.

At 1400 GMT, the crown had firmed to 4.1140 against the mark from 4.1480 at the same time on Tuesday. The crown was quoted at 100.77 against the inverse ECU index, a European basket of currencies, a bit stronger than the 101.60 reading on Tuesday.
* 2007 bond yield eight points lower at 6.12 pct
* Norway over Bunds gap five points narrower at 28 points
* Three-month eurokrone four points lower at 3.48 pct
